Commentary: Hasan Ali to van Wyk, no run, back of a length and outside off, slashed to point
Hasan Ali to van Wyk, no run, pitched up and outside off, encourages the drive. Forward and stroked to mid-off
Hasan Ali to van Wyk, no run, some swing for Hasan. Nice and full, shapes away outside off, past the flash
Hasan Ali to van Wyk, 1 run, length ball on off, jabbing drive to mid-off
Hasan Ali to Ahmed Shehzad, no run, back of a length on off, Hasan cramps Shehzad for room. Played back to the bowler
Hasan Ali to Ahmed Shehzad, no run, keeps it on a back of a length on off stump, Shehzad punchily drives a single to mid-off
Mohammad Asghar to van Wyk, no run, starts off with a full non-turning ball, misses the sweep, hit on the front pad outside the line of off I think. He weathers the lbw appeal
Mohammad Asghar to van Wyk, no run, full on middle, pushed to midwicket

Mohammad Asghar to van Wyk, OUT, short fine leg swoops down on the ball and nails a direct hit. Excellent work from Hasan, catches Van Wyk short. The batsman uses his feet, attempts a flick, and inside-edges the ball to Hasan. Van Wyk eyes a risky single but it sent back by Shehzad. He can't make it in time
Mohammad Asghar to Anamul Haque, no run, tossed up on off, defended back
Mohammad Asghar to Anamul Haque, no run, full and outside off, tapped to cover on the front foot
Mohammad Asghar to Anamul Haque, 1 run, full and around off, push-driven to long-off
Hasan Ali to Anamul Haque, 1 run, Down the track, heaves at the ball and squirts an inside edge to long leg
Hasan Ali to Ahmed Shehzad, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, might have been a cutter, slashes early in the air to the left of backward point. Yes, this offcutter gripped in the surface
Hasan Ali to Anamul Haque, no run, that's a gem! Good length, angled in, and cuts away viciously past the outside edge. Unplayable

Hasan Ali to Anamul Haque, no run, Sammy drops a catch at slip! Pitched up and outside off, Shehzad reaches out for a drive, plays away from the body, and nicks it behind. The ball hits Sammy's chest and goes down. It just flew to slip. Sammy was late to react
Hasan Ali to Anamul Haque, no run, back of a length and angled in, Anumul eyes the leg side and ends up squirting a leading edge towards point
Hasan Ali to Anamul Haque, 1 run, short on off, hits the splice of the bat, the ball rolls to mid-on

Mohammad Asghar to Anamul Haque, OUT, The reprieve costs Peshawar just one run. Anamul holes out to long-off. Jordan is a quality fielder, be it in the slip cordon or in the outfield. Anamul uses his feet, does not get close enough to the pitch. He aimed to hit it squarer, ended up punting it straighter to long-off
Mohammad Asghar to Sarfraz Ahmed, no run, slower and turns outside off, forward and pushed to cover
Wicket: ['Anamul Haque c Jordan b Mohammad Asghar 3 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33']

Commentary: Mohammad Asghar to Sarfraz Ahmed, no run, quicker and angled in on middle and leg, worked to leg
Mohammad Asghar to Sarfraz Ahmed, FOUR, Sarfraz shows intent. Jumps outside leg, manufactures room, takes this from outside off and flays a square-cut
Mohammad Asghar to Sarfraz Ahmed, FOUR, tossed up on off, Sarfraz jumps down the track and dares to go against the spin. Smacks it over midwicket
Mohammad Asghar to Sarfraz Ahmed, no run, lobbed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
Hasan Ali to Ahmed Shehzad, no run, back of a length and angled in on off, punched to cover

Hasan Ali to Ahmed Shehzad, OUT, Hasan bounces out Shehzad. Quetta lose their top three inside five overs. Shehzad is being asked to wait. The umpires check for a possible no-ball. It looks tight. Think the foot is on the line. The benefit of the doubt should go to Hasan. TV umpire Raza ultimately sends Shehzad back. Quick short ball on off, aimed at the chest of Shehzad. He is late onto the pull, ends up top-edging it to midwicket
Hasan Ali to Ervine, 1 run, back of a length and outside off, punched in the direction of midwicket
Hasan Ali to Sarfraz Ahmed, no run, back of a length and seams away outside off, past the outside edge
Wicket: ['Ahmed Shehzad c Khushdil Shah b Hasan Ali 1 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00']

Commentary: Hasan Ali to Sarfraz Ahmed, FOUR, back of a length and outside off, presses forward and punchily drives it in the gap at cover
Hasan Ali to Sarfraz Ahmed, 2 runs, short and outside off, dragged away to deep square leg
Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, 1 run, full on off, nudged to deep square leg
Mohammad Hafeez to Sarfraz Ahmed, FOUR, Sarfraz pre-meditates shuffling outside the leg stump and slashing this fine of short third man
Mohammad Hafeez to Sarfraz Ahmed, FOUR, tossed up on off, Sarfraz stretches forward and sweeps it up and over square leg

Mohammad Hafeez to Sarfraz Ahmed, OUT, One shot too many from Sarfraz? He has to go. Hafeez leaves Quetta four down. Sarfraz rushes down the track and attempts a big hack. Hafeez lobs it up just outside off and gets it to dip at the charging batsman. Sarfraz misses, Kamran swipes the bails off
Mohammad Hafeez to Saad Nasim, 1 run, flighted offbreak outside off, patted to point
Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, 1 run, flatter and faster on middle and leg, whipped out to deep midwicket
Jordan to Ervine, 1 run, short on off, stays back and knocks it to midwicket
Wicket: ['Sarfraz Ahmed st †Kamran Akmal b Mohammad Hafeez 22 (11b 5x4 0x6) SR: 200.00']

Commentary: Jordan to Saad Nasim, 1 run, back of a length on off, poked to leg for one
Jordan to Ervine, 1 run, full on the pads, flicked away to mid-on
Jordan to Saad Nasim, 1 run, short on off, pulled on the back foot to deep midwicket
Jordan to Ervine, 1 run, slower awaycutter, hangs back and dabs to point
Jordan to Saad Nasim, 1 run, rising short ball on off, Nasim rises with it and fends to cover-point
Wahab Riaz to Saad Nasim, no run, back of a length and on off stump, no room to work with, played back to the bowler

Wahab Riaz to Saad Nasim, OUT, Quetta five down and sinking. One Lahore boy takes down another. Full on middle, the loft was on, but the execution was bad. The bat twisted in his hands, so Nasim got more height as opposed to distance. Picks out Ahmed at long-on
Wahab Riaz to Ervine, 1 run, very full on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, no run, rapid short ball aimed at the chest, fended
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, no run, short on middle, blocked back to the bowler
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, no run, keeps it short, the line is outside off, played with soft hands to cover
Wicket: ['Saad Nasim c Iftikhar Ahmed b Wahab Riaz 4 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66']

Commentary: Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, 2 runs, full and straight, clipped away to deep midwicket
Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, FOUR, Ervine skips down the track, meets the pitch, and drives inside-out over extra cover. Laced it
Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, 1 run, pushed through on off, inside-edged square through on leg
Mohammad Hafeez to Anwar Ali, 1 run, short on off, forced down to long-on
Mohammad Hafeez to Ervine, 1 run, whipped from off stump to long-on
Mohammad Hafeez to Anwar Ali, 1 run, slides on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, no run, short and wide outside off, stabbed away to backward point, where Hafeez dives full-length to his right to stop the ball
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, FOUR, dug short and just outside off, arches his back, uses the pace of Wahab to his advantage, and ramps it to the third-man fence
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, 1 run, Anwar opens the bat-face and secures a single down to third man
Wahab Riaz to Ervine, 1 run, back of a length and outside off, guided down to deep third man
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, no run, Wahab slams a short ball on middle, defended back to the bowler
Wahab Riaz to Anwar Ali, 1 run, full and outside off, driven to cover. The score is 55 for 5.
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, 1 run, short and angled in on off, punched down to long-off
Mohammad Asghar to Ervine, 1 run, down the track, the bowler shortens his length, hit to long-on
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, 1 run, speared short and outside off, square-cut away for one
Mohammad Asghar to Ervine, 1 run, Ervine steps away outside leg, takes a shortish ball from outside off, and slices through cover-point
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, no run, near yorker outside off, jabbed to cover
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, 1 run, short and angled in on off, Anwar sits back and deflects the ball behind square on the leg side
Jordan to Anwar Ali, 1 run, back of a length and angled in on middle and leg, Anwar crouches and dabs a single to midwicket
Jordan to Ervine, 1 run, short and outside off, this is more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull as the ball rolls behind square
Jordan to Anwar Ali, 1 leg bye, back of a length and angled in on middle, grazes the pad and sneaks away fine on the off side. Height was an issue. Think it was slipping down leg as well
Jordan to Ervine, FOUR, with fine leg inside the circle you can't bowl on leg stump. Slower cutter, glanced fine of short fine leg
Jordan to Ervine, 1 run, back of a length on the hips, pulled to the right of short fine leg
Jordan to Anwar Ali, 1 leg bye, Anwar moves outside leg, Jordan follows him and pings the pad as the ball wanders away square through the off side
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, 1 run, short and angled in on middle, nudged to short fine leg
Mohammad Asghar to Ervine, 1 leg bye, Ervine uses his feet, the left-armer drags his length back and strikes the thigh
Mohammad Asghar to Anwar Ali, 1 run, full on off, hint of turn, Anwar opens the bat-face and steers towards backward point

Mohammad Asghar to Ervine, OUT, Asghar returns and takes down Ervine. He celebrates the wicket with a fist pump. Sammy is pumped too. Poor shot from Ervine. He backs away outside leg, exposing his stumps. Then looks to cut a ball that isn't really short. Looks to cut against the spin. Eventually, he does not make contact. The ball skids on and it's timbaaah

Mohammad Asghar to Mohammad Nawaz, OUT, stumping chance sent upstairs. Tossed up and drifts away outside off, drags Nawaz forward and goes past the outside edge. Kamran collects the ball and takes the bails off. Nawaz loses his balance and lifts his back leg. Seems like the foot is on the line by the time the bails come off. Tough one for Raza, the TV umpire. Out is the verdict. Two wickets in two balls, Peshawar are closing in on the title
Mohammad Asghar to Emrit, no run, lobbed up on off, Asghar hangs it in the air, drops down, no turn, defended with a straight bat. Asghar finishes with 3 for 16
Sammy to Anwar Ali, 1 run, slower full-toss outside off, carved to the off-side sweeper
Sammy to Emrit, 1 run
Sammy to Anwar Ali, 1 run, skiddy short ball on middle, attempts a pull, and mis-times it to square leg
Sammy to Emrit, 1 run, short of a length and outside off, swiped to deep midwicket
Sammy to Anwar Ali, FOUR, slower short ball outside off, hip-high delivery, Anwar waits for the ball to arrive and swats it disdainfully between long-on and deep midwicket
Wicket: ['Mohammad Nawaz (3) st †Kamran Akmal b Mohammad Asghar 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00']

Commentary: Sammy to Anwar Ali, no run, seam-up short ball outside off, bounces over the cut of the batsman
Jordan to Emrit, no run, short of a length, attached with width outside off, cut straight to backward point
Jordan to Emrit, no run, back of a length, angled in, and straightens away outside off. Jumps past the outside edge
Jordan to Emrit, 1 run, short and cramps the batsman for room. Pulled, but not off the middle, to deep midwicket

Jordan to Anwar Ali, OUT, Peshawar are just two away from victory. No Anwar Ali rescue act. Short of a length and skids on outside off, Anwar is late onto the pull. He eyes up midwicket and ends up top-edging a catch to extra-cover
Jordan to Emrit, 1 run, short on off stump, pulled on the back foot to long-on
Jordan to Hasan Khan, 1 run, short on middle and leg, cramps 'em up for room. Fended behind square on the leg side
Wahab Riaz to Hasan Khan, 2 runs, back of a length on off, twirls his wrists and whips to deep midwicket
Wahab Riaz to Hasan Khan, 1 run, short rising ball on off stump, hustles the batsman for pace. Tickled towards point
Wahab Riaz to Emrit, 1 run, short on middle, Rayad gets inside the line and swats to short fine leg
Wahab Riaz to Hasan Khan, no run, short and rapid on middle, flat-batted to mid-off
Wahab Riaz to Hasan Khan, no run, short and just outside off, upper-cuts and does not connect
Wicket: ['Anwar Ali c Iftikhar Ahmed b Jordan 20 (24b 2x4 0x6) SR: 83.33']

Commentary: Wahab Riaz to Hasan Khan, OUT, Peshawar are just one away from securing the title. Wahab beats another batsman for pace. Chest-hunting short ball on the leg stump, Hasan simply lobs a catch to Sammy at midwicket
Hasan Ali to Zulfiqar Babar, 1 run, back of a length and outside off, crunched through the covers
Hasan Ali to Emrit, 1 run, short and outside off, smeared away to deep midwicket, straight to the fielder

Hasan Ali to Zulfiqar Babar, OUT, Peshawar Zalmi are the champions of the second season of the PSL! The fireworks go off, and Sammy calls his boys for the selfie celebration. Then every Peshawar player attempts the Afridi star-man pose. The crowd goes berserk. Well done, Peshawar. They rejoice further. It was Hasan who set it up with the new ball and sealed it with the old one. This was full and right on the off stump. Babar looks to slug it away across the line. He only connects with a whole lot of thin air. The off stump is tilted back
